<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/31/apple-reported-sinking-iphone-sales-stock-still-jumped?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple’s iPhone Is on Low-Power Mode
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’re not the only one still clinging to your iPhone SE. When Apple reported earnings yesterday, it revealed that iPhone sales in the latest quarter fell almost 12% year-over-year. And where the iPhone goes, profits follow: Net income <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/30/technology/apple-earnings-iphone.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a> almost 13%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But the company's stock did shoot up over 4% after hours</strong>. Other parts of Apple’s business picked up the slack, and total revenue grew 1% to $53.8 billion. Plus...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Apple estimated a generous $61-$64 billion in revenue for its current quarter. That estimate is closely watched by investors because it takes into account Apple’s </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/apple-earnings-guidance-iphone-china-trade-war-4b7e9a4e-2fce-441b-b78d-366ac73fcfb2.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">initial forecast</a></span><span> for sales of its next iPhone models.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>While sales continued to fall in the Greater China region, the 4% decrease wasn’t nearly as gnarly as the 22% drop the previous quarter. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Smartphones are old news</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We all have that one friend who lives for the phone upgrade, but in general consumers <a href="https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2019/1/3/18167072/apple-iphone-sales-down-china-upgrades-q1-2018?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">aren't interested</a> in parting with their phones. To keep the lanyards at the Apple Store busy, the company’s had to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-30/apple-seen-forecasting-revenue-decline-for-iphone-launch-quarter?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">offer discounts</a>, financing, and trade-in offers that would’ve seemed unnecessary a few years ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because Apple is well aware we’re past “peak smartphone,” it wants to capitalize on trends still on the up through its Services division (13% sales growth last quarter). </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’ll be launching a credit card next month, a subscription streaming service this fall, and a video game subscription service, Apple Arcade, also in the next few months. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Looking ahead </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China remains a <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/apple-s-strength-china-boosts-sales-despite-trade-tensions-n1036416?cid=public-rss_20190730&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crucial region</a> for the company for both production and sales. That means “keep tabs on the trade war” is always at the top of CEO Tim Cook’s to-do list.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest? </strong>President Trump may be bailing out farmers hit by the trade war, but he’s certainly not helping out Apple.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1564523029.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F07%2F31%2Fapple-reported-sinking-iphone-sales-stock-still-jumped" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Smartphones+are+old+news&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/31/apple-reported-sinking-iphone-sales-stock-still-jumped&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/31/huawei-shrugs-off-u-s-blacklist?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Huawei Revenue Is...Way Up?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You don't get to hog the spotlight, Apple. Let's keep rolling with tech earnings. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Proving it’s neither down nor out, Chinese tech giant Huawei <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-huawei-tech-results/huawei-warns-on-u-s-ban-after-china-smartphone-sales-drive-first-half-revenue-idUSKCN1UP0LI?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted</a> strong Q2 results Tuesday. Revenue for the first six months of 2019 hit $58.3 billion, up 23% compared to 2018. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company’s been dealing with a U.S. blacklist, but 5G and Chinese customers always take a little supplier disruption in stride.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Leading global 5G rollouts: </strong></span><span>Since the ban went into effect mid-May, Huawei added 11 5G contracts, bumping its total to 50 deals. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Driving phone addictions:</strong></span><span> Even as global smartphone sales slide, Huawei’s </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/30/huawei-china-smartphone-shipments-surge-31-percent-in-q2-canalys.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased market share</a></span><span> at home to 38%. Its consumer segment accounts for more than half its revenue, with $32.1 billion in H1 sales. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it’s not all smiles in Shenzhen, where Huawei execs expect “difficulties ahead” in H2. CEO Ren Zhengfei <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/17/huawei-slashes-revenue-forecast-amid-us-pressure-in-trade-war.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">previously said</a> the ban could keep revenue at 2018 levels through next year. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Anybody handling this? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S.-China trade talks re-re-re-resumed Tuesday. President Trump <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/07/30/trump-backpedals-china-threats-trade-deal-shows-signs-slipping-away/?utm_term=.43b631541354&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> China against trying to delay negotiations until after the 2020 elections.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/31/dan-gilbert-s-impact-detroit-real-estate?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Dan Gilbert’s Real Life Sim City
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Tonight, the second round of Democratic primary debates <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/30/us/politics/democratic-debate-time.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">kicks off in Detroit</a> at 8pm ET. Time to meet <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/quicken-loans-dan-gilbert-detroit-2018-8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the businessman</a> who claims some credit for the host city’s revitalization: Dan Gilbert, billionaire founder of mortgage lender Quicken Loans and majority owner of the Cleveland Cavaliers. He’s currently recovering from a May 26 stroke. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Gilbert’s role in recent Detroit history: </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2010, Detroit was wrestling economic challenges that would lead to <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/petesaunders1/2018/07/19/detroit-five-years-after-bankruptcy/#28c9e451cfeb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the largest municipal bankruptcy in American history</a> in terms of debt. Gilbert, who grew up nearby, felt a pang of hometown pride and... </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Moved Quicken Loans to downtown Detroit. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The next year, started Bedrock, a real estate company that bought up blighted properties. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bedrock's now invested and committed over $5.6 billion in the city since 2011. The company owns around 100 properties in the downtown area, and Gilbert’s family of companies is one of Detroit’s largest employers, minority employers, and taxpayers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Gilbert also has a family of critics </strong>who argue his development focus on the downtown area has caused tensions around Detroit, the country's largest majority-black city.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
NATURAL RESOURCES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/31/bureau-land-management-new-chief?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
To Be or Not to BLM
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One thing <em>Westworld</em> got wrong: You don’t need sexy cyborgs to make Western landscapes divisive. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Secretary of the Interior David Bernhardt on Monday <a href="https://apnews.com/3b7301e7e4d44a6ebb33eed0766fb850?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">designated</a> William Perry Pendley acting head of the Bureau of Land Management (BLM), the federal agency that manages about 250 million acres of public land in the U.S. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>He was a controversial choice. Pendley is part of a movement to transfer federal lands to the states and has even </span><span><a href="https://www.nationalreview.com/2016/01/federal-government-should-sell-western-land-follow-constitution/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">advocated for</a></span><span> selling off public land. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that means: </strong>Pendley, who once worked for the Interior Department under Ronald Reagan, believes protected land should be opened up to business interests including energy development, mining, and ranching.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This may be the perfect job for him. Under the Trump administration, the BLM has moved its headquarters from Washington, D.C., to Colorado, a move a former director <a href="https://news.bloombergenvironment.com/environment-and-energy/ex-blm-chiefs-say-interior-is-moving-to-transfer-land-to-states?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">claimed was intended</a> to advance the land transfer movement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But...</strong>the BLM hasn’t exactly been stable under President Trump. He’s <a href="https://www.eenews.net/stories/1060787775?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">never nominated</a> a permanent director for Senate confirmation, so it’s not entirely clear how much influence Pendley will have.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FED
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/07/31/fed-s-expected-cut-interest-rates-today?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Fed Isn't Playing Games, but We Are
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, Jerome Powell and his merry crew of central bankers are expected to announce an <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-fed-dissent/possible-dissent-hangs-over-feds-first-rate-cut-in-a-decade-idUSKCN1UP10Y?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interest rate cut</a> for the first time since 2008. It’s a decision that’ll affect every slice of the economy, from finance to real estate to even you, the consumer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you don’t watch Powell’s press conference tomorrow afternoon...we get it. The heart can only handle so much excitement. But if you do, make sure you print out the Brew’s Fed Bingo board and play along.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1564512815.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Francis Scialabba </em></sup></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

When Apple reported earnings yesterday, it revealed that iPhone sales in the latest quarter fell almost 12% year-over-year. And where the iPhone goes, profits follow: Net income \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/30/technology/apple-earnings-iphone.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e almost 13%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut the company's stock did shoot up over 4% after hours\u003c/strong\u003e. Other parts of Apple’s business picked up the slack, and total revenue grew 1% to $53.8 billion. Plus...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eApple estimated a generous $61-$64 billion in revenue for its current quarter. That estimate is closely watched by investors because it takes into account Apple’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/apple-earnings-guidance-iphone-china-trade-war-4b7e9a4e-2fce-441b-b78d-366ac73fcfb2.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einitial forecast\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for sales of its next iPhone models.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhile sales continued to fall in the Greater China region, the 4% decrease wasn’t nearly as gnarly as the 22% drop the previous quarter. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSmartphones are old news\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe all have that one friend who lives for the phone upgrade, but in general consumers \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/the-goods/2019/1/3/18167072/apple-iphone-sales-down-china-upgrades-q1-2018?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earen't interested\u003c/a\u003e in parting with their phones. To keep the lanyards at the Apple Store busy, the company’s had to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-07-30/apple-seen-forecasting-revenue-decline-for-iphone-launch-quarter?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eoffer discounts\u003c/a\u003e, financing, and trade-in offers that would’ve seemed unnecessary a few years ago. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause Apple is well aware we’re past “peak smartphone,” it wants to capitalize on trends still on the up through its Services division (13% sales growth last quarter). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’ll be launching a credit card next month, a subscription streaming service this fall, and a video game subscription service, Apple Arcade, also in the next few months. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLooking ahead \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/apple-s-strength-china-boosts-sales-despite-trade-tensions-n1036416?cid=public-rss_20190730\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" Let's keep rolling with tech earnings. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eProving it’s neither down nor out, Chinese tech giant Huawei \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-huawei-tech-results/huawei-warns-on-u-s-ban-after-china-smartphone-sales-drive-first-half-revenue-idUSKCN1UP0LI?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eposted\u003c/a\u003e strong Q2 results Tuesday. Revenue for the first six months of 2019 hit $58.3 billion, up 23% compared to 2018. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company’s been dealing with a U.S. blacklist, but 5G and Chinese customers always take a little supplier disruption in stride.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLeading global 5G rollouts: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSince the ban went into effect mid-May, Huawei added 11 5G contracts, bumping its total to 50 deals. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDriving phone addictions:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Even as global smartphone sales slide, Huawei’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/07/30/huawei-china-smartphone-shipments-surge-31-percent-in-q2-canalys.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased market share\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at home to 38%. Its consumer segment accounts for more than half its revenue, with $32.1 billion in H1 sales. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut it’s not all smiles in Shenzhen, where Huawei execs expect “difficulties ahead” in H2. CEO Ren Zhengfei \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/06/17/huawei-slashes-revenue-forecast-amid-us-pressure-in-trade-war.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreviously said\u003c/a\u003e the ban could keep revenue at 2018 levels through next year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnybody handling this? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.S.-China trade talks re-re-re-resumed Tuesday. City\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTonight, the second round of Democratic primary debates \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/30/us/politics/democratic-debate-time.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ekicks off in Detroit\u003c/a\u003e at 8pm ET. Time to meet \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/quicken-loans-dan-gilbert-detroit-2018-8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe businessman\u003c/a\u003e who claims some credit for the host city’s revitalization: Dan Gilbert, billionaire founder of mortgage lender Quicken Loans and majority owner of the Cleveland Cavaliers. He’s currently recovering from a May 26 stroke. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGilbert’s role in recent Detroit history: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2010, Detroit was wrestling economic challenges that would lead to \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/petesaunders1/2018/07/19/detroit-five-years-after-bankruptcy/#28c9e451cfeb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe largest municipal bankruptcy in American history\u003c/a\u003e in terms of debt. Gilbert, who grew up nearby, felt a pang of hometown pride and... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMoved Quicken Loans to downtown Detroit. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe next year, started Bedrock, a real estate company that bought up blighted properties. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBedrock's now invested and committed over $5.6 billion in the city since 2011. The company owns around 100 properties in the downtown area, and Gilbert’s family of companies is one of Detroit’s largest employers, minority employers, and taxpayers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGilbert also has a family of critics \u003c/strong\u003ewho argue his development focus on the style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne thing \u003cem\u003eWestworld\u003c/em\u003e got wrong: You don’t need sexy cyborgs to make Western landscapes divisive. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSecretary of the Interior David Bernhardt on Monday \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/3b7301e7e4d44a6ebb33eed0766fb850?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edesignated\u003c/a\u003e William Perry Pendley acting head of the Bureau of Land Management (BLM), the federal agency that manages about 250 million acres of public land in the U.S. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eHe was a controversial choice. Pendley is part of a movement to transfer federal lands to the states and has even \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalreview.com/2016/01/federal-government-should-sell-western-land-follow-constitution/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eadvocated for\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e selling off public land. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat that means: \u003c/strong\u003ePendley, who once worked for the Interior Department under Ronald Reagan, believes protected land should be opened up to business interests including energy development, mining, and ranching.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis may be the perfect job for him. Under the Trump administration, the BLM has moved its headquarters from Washington, D.C., to Colorado, a move a former director \u003ca href=\"https://news.bloombergenvironment.com/environment-and-energy/ex-blm-chiefs-say-interior-is-moving-to-transfer-land-to-states?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclaimed was intended\u003c/a\u003e to advance the land transfer movement.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut...\u003c/strong\u003ethe BLM hasn’t exactly been stable under President Trump. He’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.eenews.net/stories/1060787775?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enever nominated\u003c/a\u003e a permanent director for Senate confirmation, so it’s not entirely clear how much influence Pendley will
